items.title: Investor Questions for Aerospace Seed
items.summary: Key investor questions seed aerospace founders should prepare for.

questions.question: What is the wedge problem and why does it matter now?
questions.answer: Investors want a clear, painful problem and a timing advantage. Anchor the answer in a market shift, regulation, or platform change.

questions.question: Who is the primary buyer and how do you reach them efficiently?
questions.answer: Name the buyer role, the first channel you dominate, and the path from pilot to paid account.

questions.question: What makes this defensible beyond execution speed?
questions.answer: Highlight proprietary data, workflow lock-in, regulatory approvals, or supply chain advantages.

questions.question: What early signals prove pull from the market?
questions.answer: Share the strongest signal of demand and how it translates into repeatable pipeline.

questions.question: How will unit economics improve as you scale?
questions.answer: Explain how margins improve with learning curves, automation, or better procurement.

questions.question: What milestones unlock the next round?
questions.answer: Define technical, revenue, and compliance milestones tied to Series A readiness.

metrics.label: Sales cycle length
metrics.value: Document pilot to paid conversion timeline
metrics.note: Seed and Series A investors expect evidence of repeatability.

metrics.label: Pilot conversion rate
metrics.value: Track pilots that convert to paid agreements
metrics.note: Show the leading indicator that validates the go-to-market motion.

metrics.label: Gross margin plan
metrics.value: Explain margin expansion levers
metrics.note: Investors look for improving margins at scale.

metrics.label: Capital intensity
metrics.value: Outline capital needs per unit of growth
metrics.note: Highlight how automation or scale reduces capital burden.

objections.objection: Adoption cycles are too long for this market.
objections.response: Show short-cycle pilots and a path to land-and-expand with reference customers.

objections.objection: The product requires heavy upfront investment.
objections.response: Detail staged milestones and how funds unlock measurable de-risking.
